common: There are no available data on use in pregnant women to evaluate for drug-associated risk of major birth defects, miscarriage, or adverse maternal or fetal outcomes; consider discontinuing drug when pregnancy is recognized

description: In animal reproduction studies, drug increased skeletal deviations and variations in mouse offspring at subcutaneous doses equivalent to more than 60 times recommended 20 mcg human daily dose (based on body surface area, mcg/m
), and produced mild growth retardation and reduced motor activity in rat offspring at subcutaneous doses equivalent to more than 120 times the human dose

common: Not known whether teriparatide is excreted in human milk, affects human milk production, or has effects on breastfed infant; because of potential for osteosarcoma shown in animal studies, advise patients that breastfeeding is not recommended during therapy
Transient orthostatic hypotension may occur with initial doses
May exacerbate urolithiasis; consider risk/benefit in patients with active or recent urolithiasis

description: Avoid use in patients with with increased risk of osteosarcoma including those with
Metabolic bone diseases including Paget disease, bone metastases, or history of skeletal malignancies
Prior external beam or implant radiation therapy involving the skeleton
Avoid in patients known to have an underlying hypercalcemic disorder
Discontinue in patients developing worsening of previously stable cutaneous calcification
Hypercalcemia may predispose patient to digoxin toxicity
A single teriparatide dose did not alter the effect of digoxin on the systolic time interval
Owing to teriparatide may transiently increase serum calcium, use with caution in patients taking digoxin
Consider potential onset of signs and symptoms of digitalis toxicity when used in patients receiving digoxin

description.common:
teriparatide increases toxicity of digoxin by Other (see comment). Use Caution/Monitor. 
Comment: Transient hypercalcemia may predispose to digoxin toxicity (rare case reports).

teriparatide, alendronate. Other (see comment). Minor/Significance Unknown. 
Comment: No advantage to bone density with combined treatment.
teriparatide increases levels of calcium acetate by pharmacodynamic synergism. Minor/Significance Unknown.
teriparatide increases levels of calcium carbonate by pharmacodynamic synergism. Minor/Significance Unknown.
teriparatide increases levels of calcium chloride by pharmacodynamic synergism. Minor/Significance Unknown.
teriparatide increases levels of calcium citrate by pharmacodynamic synergism. Minor/Significance Unknown.
teriparatide increases levels of calcium gluconate by pharmacodynamic synergism. Minor/Significance Unknown.

Comment: No advantage to bone density with combined treatment.

adverse effects.name: Cases of bone tumor and osteosarcoma reported rarely in the postmarketing period
osteosarcoma surveillance safety studies in US were designed to obtain data on the incidence rate of osteosarcoma among teriparatide
Results suggest similar risk for osteosarcoma between teriparatide users and their comparators
interpretation of the results calls for caution owing to the limitations of the data sources which do not allow for complete measurement and control for confounders
